Umberto Michieli
Ph.D. in Information Engineering
AI Research Intern at Samsung Research UK
Download CV

About

I am a Computer Vision and Deep Learning research scientist. My goal is to contribute to the continual adaptation of AI to human needs and its adoption into everyday life.

I was born in Italy in 1994. I got my B.Sc and M.Sc. respectively in Information Engineering (2016) and in Telecommunication Engineering (2018) from the University of Padova.
Currently, I am a final-year Ph.D. candidate at the Department of Information Engineering of the same University under the supervision of Pietro Zanuttigh in the LTTM lab.

In 2018 I was a Visiting Research at the Technische Universität Dresden in the Biomedical Cybernetics Group led by Carlo Vittorio Cannistraci (now director of the Center for Complex Network Intelligence at Tsinghua University).

Until May 2021 I am an AI Research Intern at Samsung Research UK under the supervision of Mete Ozay.

My main research interests are:
- Continual Learning: train deep learning models to incrementally learn new concepts over time.
- Unsupervised Domain Adaptation: adapt deep neural networks trained on large datasets, where the generation of the ground-truth is inexpensive, to other data without labels.
- Federated Learning: collaboratively train deep learning models without sharing private user data.

Check out the publications section and my Google Scholar profile to know more about these topics.

LaTeX templates for BS and MS thesis

Here are reported the templates which I used for my BS and MS thesis. The second one is an evolution of the other and it is richer. Those are not official templates and they can be adapted to different requirements.

[MS] Michieli U., "Link Prediction on Real and Synthetic Complex Networks", MS Thesis in Telecommunication Engineering, Department of Information Engineering, University of Padova, September 2018, [PDF], [LaTeX template] [slides] [template slides].

[BS] Michieli U., "Correlation and Coherence Analysis between EEG and EMG signals", BS Thesis in Information Engineering, Department of Information Engineering, University of Padova, July 2016, [PDF] [LaTeX template] [slides] [template slides].

Selection of MS Course Projects

Network Science:

Analisys of the network topology in men's single tennis matches. Read more in [ArXiV], [HW1] and [HW2]. The networks used in this report are collected in [dataset].

Computer Vision:

Images merging and Object Recognition in images and video using SURF, SIFT and LBP. Read the report [PDF].

Wireless Communications:

Modeling of Markov fading wireless channel, in collaboration with Ettore Mariotti and Pietro Tonello. Read the report [PDF].

Telecommunication Networks:

Coexistence of Machine-to-Machine and Human-to-Human types of communication in LTE networks (analysis conducted in ns-3), in collaboration with Mattia Lecci and in collaboration with Matteo Ciprian. Read the report [PDF] or have a look at the [slides] of the presentation.

Source Coding:

Implementation of the LBG algorithm for CD-quality audio signals compression. Read the report [PDF] or have a look at the [slides] of the presentation.

Telemedicine:

Literature overview on closed-loop deep brain stimulation, in collaboration with Matilde Boschiero. Read the report [PDF] or have a look at the [slides] of the presentation.
